title: datalad does not work within Git bash on Windows
body:
Not sure what the core issue is, or what could be done about it. I do know that GitPython doesn't see Git, maybe because it tries an absolute windows path that bash on Windows cannot handle.

````
$ DATALAD_LOG_LEVEL=1 python -c 'from datalad.support.gitrepo import GitRepo; r=GitRepo("dummy", create=True)'
[Level 5] Done importing main __init__
[Level 5] Importing support.network
[Level 5] Done importing support.network
[Level 5] Parsed ri dummy into fields {'username': '', 'scheme': '', 'fragment': '', 'hostname': '', 'query': '', 'path': 'dummy', 'password': '', 'port': ''}
[Level 5] Detected file ri
[DEBUG] Initialize empty Git repository at 'C:\Users\Pussy Galore\datalad\dummy'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "datalad\support\repo.py", line 146, in __call__
    instance = type.__call__(cls, *new_args, **new_kwargs)
  File "datalad\support\gitrepo.py", line 534, in __init__
    **git_opts)
  File "datalad\cmd.py", line 134, in __call__
    return self.call(cmd, *args, **kwargs)
  File "datalad\cmd.py", line 485, in call
    return f(*args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\git\repo\base.py", line 851, in init
    git.init(**kwargs)
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\git\cmd.py", line 423, in <lambda>
    return lambda *args, **kwargs: self._call_process(name, *args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\git\cmd.py", line 868, in _call_process
    return self.execute(call, **_kwargs)
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\git\cmd.py", line 600, in execute
    raise GitCommandNotFound(command, err)
git.exc.GitCommandNotFound: Cmd('C:\Program Files\Git\usr\bin\git') not found due to: WindowsError('[Error 2] Das System kann die angegebene Datei nicht finden')
  cmdline: C:\Program Files\Git\usr\bin\git init
[Level 5] Exiting
````

but

````
$ git version
git version 2.10.2.windows.1
````
